title: Professional Portfolio
descriptionFull: I can imagine every web developer feels the need to create a personal website.

When I began to plan for mine, I knew I wanted to have the site showcase many types of information in an easy-to-follow, but interesting manner.  The categories and styles I settled upon are the ones you see here.

title: BMI Calculator Revisited
descriptionFull: While the functionality of this application is on the topic of medical metrics, the value of developing this application is to practice the design methodology of React component architecture.
A guide to run acceptance and unit tests upon building this application locally, and a description of the design approach for this application, is discussed in the github documentation.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
descriptionShort: A digital rendition of a childhood game.
descriptionFull: My guess as to why Rock Paper Scissors was so popular when I was a child what that it was simple to learn, and exciting!  Yelling and throwing your hands around is always a good time.
This implementation of RPS as a web game strives to capture all of the simplicity, and give a nod to the excitement through the rendering of images that mirror the game outcomes.

The game is played by clicking on the Player 1 option buttons (don't choose new options too quickly, the images take time to load).  Furthermore, unit and feature tests can be run with a local build as described in the Github documentation.

title: Address Book
descriptionShort: A sleek UI to store contacts.
descriptionFull: The Address Book application focuses on implementing styles from a content delivery network (CDN) and using session storage in the browser to mimic CRUD functionality usually implemented with an api, but with a front-end-only solution.
A demonstration flow for the live site, and a process to generate a local build and run feature tests, is provided in the github documentation.
